title: Firefox now with webfonts support
content:
The latest beta and the nightly builds of Firefox 3.1 now support webfonts.  
Full article: [http://opentype.info/blog/2008/10/25/sneak-peek-font-face-in-firefox-31/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420035720/http:/opentype.info/blog/2008/10/25/sneak-peek-font-face-in-firefox-31/ "http://opentype.info/blog/2008/10/25/sneak-peek-font-face-in-firefox-31/")

BTW: The final release will support Access Control Headers, which can be used to control from which domains the font can be accessed - a kind of server-side URL-binding.
author: Typography.Guru

comments.content: FYI to anyone thinking about installing this beta: I’ve been using it for a few days now and it’s not remotely stable. Only install it if you don’t mind it crashing a few times every hour.

Are ACH some kind of industry standard, or only a Mozilla proposal? Are ACH going to be implemented in Safari as well at some time?

Szabolcs
